contentrichtext.text: :''see also [[Quick Millions (1939 film)]]'' {{Infobox Film | name = Quick Millions | image_size = | image = Quick Millions FilmPoster.jpeg | caption = | director = [[Rowland Brown]] | producer = [[William Fox (producer)|William Fox]] | writer = Rowland Brown<br />Courtney Perrett | narrator = | starring = [[Spencer Tracy]]<br />[[Marguerite Churchill]] | music = | cinematography = Joseph H. August | editing = | distributor = [[Fox Film Corporation]] | released = [[1931 in film|1931]] | runtime = 72 min. | country = {{USA}} | language = [[English language|English]] | budget = | preceded_by = | followed_by = }} '''''Quick Millions''''' is a [[1931 in film|1931]] [[Pre-Code crime films|Pre-Code crime film]] directed by Rowland Brown. The film involves a truck driver ([[Spencer Tracy]]) and the wealthy woman ([[Marguerite Churchill]]) that he covets, and also features [[George Raft]] and [[Leon Ames (actor)|Leon Ames]] in supporting roles.<ref>Everett Aaker, ''The Films of George Raft'', McFarland & Company, 2013 p 16</ref> ==Cast== *[[Spencer Tracy]] as Daniel Raymond *[[Marguerite Churchill]] as Dorothy Stone *[[Sally Eilers]] as Daisy De Lisle *[[Bob Burns (comedian)|Bob Burns]] as Arkansas Smith *[[George Raft]] as Jimmy Kirk *[[Leon Ames (actor)|Leon Ames]] as Hood ==References== {{reflist}} ==External links== *{{IMDb title|id=0022290|title=Quick Millions}} [[Category:1931 films]] [[Category:American films]] [[Category:English-language films]] [[Category:1930s crime films]] [[Category:1930s drama films]] {{crime-drama-film-stub}}
